sentences.english: Oooh, " he purred. "I bet I know what those are.
sentences.chinese: 喔，“他嘟囔着，”我敢说我知道那是什么。

sentences.english: "Blame it on the rain, " she muttered.
I heard him rumbling at the back.
sentences.chinese: 我听见他在后面直嘟囔。

sentences.english: Anna ( Lea Massari) has quarreled with her lover Sandro ( Gabriele Ferzetti), and has been overheard saying she wanted to be left alone.
sentences.chinese: 安娜和情人桑德罗吵了起来，并嘟囔着说想要独处。

sentences.english: He walked out of the room, mouthing curses.
sentences.chinese: 他走出房间，嘴里嘟嘟囔囔地咒骂着。

sentences.english: “Ah, today is just your lucky day,” he gripes.
sentences.chinese: “啊，今天是你的幸运日吧，”他不满地嘟囔道。

sentences.english: Are you just going to stand there muttering to yourself?
sentences.chinese: 你打算站在那跟自个儿嘟囔个没完是吗？

sentences.english: Drunk on his own chivalry, Ashurst went on murmuring.
sentences.chinese: 艾舍斯特沉醉于自己的骑士精神，继续嘟囔着。

sentences.english: They always complain that they need to lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 因此她们总是嘟嘟囔囔地说要减肥。

sentences.english: "Right," mumbled Crowley, suddenly feeling very alone.
sentences.chinese: “好吧”克鲁利失落地嘟囔着，他突然觉得特别孤独。

sentences.english: He rumbled as he walked that it was simply unreasonable to treat him like this.
sentences.chinese: 他一边走一边嘟囔这样对待他简直是不近人情。

sentences.english: I mumbled, she is anxious, the hand slap my face.
sentences.chinese: 我嘟囔着，她却急了，回手给我一巴掌。

sentences.english: "Luck of the devil, " muttered the angel.
You may no longer hum or do any form of beadwork.
sentences.chinese: 你不可以哼曲子或者有任何形式的嘟囔。

definition: to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
